title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient is a dominant retiree with bilateral hand Dupuytren's disease. He first noticed symptoms in his left hand many years ago, and now he is beginning to notice similar changes in his right hand. The left hand is unable to lie flat on the table due to significant contracture of the ring finger. He has a 45-degree contracture at the ring finger metacarpophalangeal (MP) joint and approximately 10 degrees of contracture at the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint. There is no measurable contracture in the remaining digits of the left hand. The right hand has intact skin with nodules along the ring finger ray, but no evidence of contracture. He is here for evaluation and treatment.

Use full sentences, proper grammar, and natural narrative style. Avoid adding adjectives, interpretations, or any information not directly dictated. Ensure the paragraph reads clearly, like a scribe note, and reflects only what is explicitly reported in the transcript.

title: Assessment
instruction: Generate the patient's Assessment section as a concise list of active problems or conditions relevant to this visit. Rules: - Include both symptom-based problems (e.g., 'hand pain', 'swelling') and diagnosis-based terms (e.g., 'trigger finger', 'wrist arthritis'). - Do not include normal findings (e.g., 'skin is intact') or negative statements (e.g., 'no tenderness to palpation'). - Only include 'status post' conditions if they describe an ongoing issue (e.g., 'stiff finger after surgery'); do not include if mentioned alone. - Keep terms short and scribe-style, without exam details or explanations. - Return the output strictly as a list (one item per line, dash or bullet). - If no active conditions are present, return the default value.
